meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting a substance that changes color when exposed to light.
meanings.sent1: The photochromic paint on the wall brightened as the sun shone through the window.
meanings.sent2: Her photochromic glasses turned dark when she stepped outside into the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The photochromic shirt seemed to play a color-changing game with the sun.
meanings.sent4: The photochromic sky shifted hues as the day progressed, like a giant canvas.
meanings.sent5: The photochromic flowers in the garden transformed under the sunlight, creating a magical display.

meanings.definition: A lens or material that darkens when exposed to sunlight.
meanings.sent1: He always wore photochromic lenses to protect his eyes from the bright sun.
meanings.sent2: The photochromic material of the car windows shaded the interior on sunny days.
meanings.sent3: The photochromic umbrella acted like a personal sunshade, adjusting its darkness.
meanings.sent4: The photochromic visor on her helmet shielded her eyes from the glaring sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The photochromic screen on the phone automatically adjusted its tint in bright light, making it easier to see.
